definition: Han Chinese name for an ancient Central Asia country
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
summer
the Xia or Hsia dynasty c. 2000 BC/Xia of the Sixteen Kingdoms (407-432)/surname Xia

sentences.english: The Science College of Great China University established a broadcasting station independently.
sentences.chinese: 大夏大学理学院自设广播台。

sentences.english: Small gold figurines found in the Bactrian hoard.
sentences.chinese: 在大夏宝藏中发现的黄金小雕像。

sentences.english: Gold flowers adorned with pearls worn as decoration by the Bactrian nomads.
sentences.chinese: 由大夏部落制作的带有珍珠装饰的金花饰物。

sentences.english: Firemen using extension ladders rescued everyone in the building.
sentences.chinese: 消防员用伸缩梯救也大夏的每一个人。

definition: Han Dynasty term for the Roman Empire 羅馬帝國|罗马帝国[Luo2 ma3 Di4 guo2]
the imperial court/the government in imperial times
Eastern Barbarians, non-Han tribe living to the east of China c 2200 BC
different tribe
Tangut branch of the Qiang 羌 ethnic group/ancient ethnic group who made up the Xixia dynasty 西夏 1038-1227
Northern Yan of the Sixteen Kingdoms (409-436)
Sino-Turkish
old place name (up to Tang), in Hengshan county 橫山縣|横山县, Yulin, Shaanxi
to found a country
Huihu, Tang dynasty name of ethnic group corresponding to modern Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]
sage ruler
Qidan or Khitan, ethnic group in ancient China, a branch of the Eastern Hu people inhabiting the valley of the Xar Murun River in the upper reaches of the Liao River 遼河|辽河[Liao2 He2]
Tubo or Tufan, old name for Tibet/the Tibetan Tubo dynasty 7th-11th century AD/also pr. [Tu3 fan1]
Korean Goryeo dynasty, 918-1392/Korea, esp. in context of art and culture

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)
the Tang dynasty (618-907)
